title: Cisco UCS
descriptionMarkdown: The [Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS)](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/servers-unified-computing/index.html) connector allows you to easily connect your Cisco UCS logs with Azure Sentinel This gives you more insight into your organization's network and improves your security operation capabilities.
additionalRequirementBanner: These queries and workbooks are dependent on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected. Follow the steps to use this Kusto functions alias **CiscoUCS** in queries and workbooks. [Follow these steps to get this Kusto functions.](https://aka.ms/sentinel-ciscoucs-function)

sampleQueries.description: Top 10 Target User Names for Audit Events
sampleQueries.query:
CiscoUCS 
 | where Mneumonic == "AUDIT" 
 | summarize count() by DstUserName 
 | top 10 by DstUserName

CiscoUCS 
 | where Mneumonic == "AUDIT" 
 | summarize count() by Computer 
 | top 10 by Computer

dataTypes.name: Syslog (CiscoUCS)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CiscoUCS 
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
CiscoUCS 
      | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

customs.name: Cisco UCS
customs.description: must be configured to export logs via Syslog

instructionSteps.description: >This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected. [Follow the steps](https://aka.ms/sentinel-ciscoucs-function) to use the Kusto function alias, **CiscoUCS**

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux
instructionSteps.description:
Typically, you should install the agent on a different computer from the one on which the logs are generated.

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected
instructionSteps.description:
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.
 1. Under workspace advanced settings **Configuration**, select **Data** and then **Syslog**.
 2. Select **Apply below configuration to my machines** and select the facilities and severities.
 3.  Click **Save**.

instructionSteps.title: 3. Configure and connect the Cisco UCS
instructionSteps.description: [Follow these instructions](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/servers-unified-computing/ucs-manager/110265-setup-syslog-for-ucs.html#configsremotesyslog) to configure the Cisco UCS to forward syslog. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux device with the Linux agent installed as the Destination IP address.
